comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: This gate is the entrance to the inner court of Tosho-gu. Tosho-gu was built in Nikko to enshrine the remains of Tokugawa Ieyasu, the founder of hte Tokugawa Shogunate. Located here. The same photo is in the collection of Nagasaki University. NPL also has a photo by Kusakabe taken from inside. NOW [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nel-tu/2560475743/]

comment.author: 87914514@N00
comment._content: Hi, this photo has been discussed in one of the threads in the Flickr Commons group, and we'd love to have this added to the group pool!

comment.author: 73286033@N00
comment._content: So that image was hand-tinted then?

comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: Yes. The quality is so good that it's easy to believe it's an early, washed-out chemical/light colorization, but this was done by artists. I'm not clear on the specifics of the process (eg, individually done by brush or performed with a block-printing system). A brief introduction is in the Wikipedia article hand-colouring.

comment.author: 34427466731@N01
comment._content: This image has been used in the indicommons.org post: Yomei Gate
